components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,FUEL SYSTEM, OTHER
summary: THIS FIRST INCIDENT WAS RATHER BENIGN.  I NOTICED MY 2002 FORD FOCUS SVT, AT 2400 MILES,  WOULD NOT PRODUCE SUSTAINED HEAT.     AFTER REPAIR, ON 12-8-02, THE VEHICLE, WITH 2800 MILES, WOULD NOT START.  IT LEFT ME STRANDED AND HAD TO BE TOWED.    I AM TOLD THE VEHICLE REQUIRES A NEW "INTAKE" FOR REPAIR AND WAS "PROBABLY" THE CAUSE OF THE INITIAL PROBLEM.    THOUGH THE INCIDENTS ARE RATHER SIMPLE, I FIND IT REDICULOUS FOR A VEHICLE WHICH WAS MADE LESS THAN 6 MONTHS AGO.
